chargeHist.descr: Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.execSummary:
The defendant Edgar G Ceballos-Alfaro was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Edgar G Ceballos-Alfaro is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Edgar G Ceballos-Alfaro was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Edgar G Ceballos-Alfaro was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Each ct concur. Eligible for early termination at 18 mo.
Concurrent with: each other

miscConds.notes: $543 to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
State will submit an order, no objection by the defense.

Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with CD except as allowed by AACD or agent in writing. Shall not be in the 4500 block of Thurston Lane in Fitchburg. Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Officer Topel except in their official law enforcement capacity.

Completion of DOC domestic violence treatment. Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  DNA On file. Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
$343 to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
All other conditions are the same as count 1.

11:31 AM Defendant Edgar G Ceballos-Alfaro in court with Attorney Doug Phebus. ADA Carl Jacob Lazarus in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to counts 1 and 3.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

AMENDMENTS: Count 3 to 947.01 with Domestic Abuse Assessment 973.055(1)

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count #2 and 4. 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNTS #1 and 3   
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years. Eligible for early termination at 18 months
Each count cc

CONDITIONS:
-No contact direct or indirect with Cinthia D except as allowed by AACD or agent in writing.
-Shall not be in the 4500 block of Thurston Lane in Fitchburg
-Shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Officer Topel except in their official law enforcement capacity.
-DOC DV treatment
-Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals 
-DNA on file
-Restitution: (State will submit an order, no objection by the defense.)
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Cts #1 and 3
-All CC, DA surcharge and V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days due on probation

-Bond posted to be applied to restitution, remainder to fines/cc. Return any balance to poster. 

-Days credit for time already served: 7 days credit  
-Days credit if revoked: 7 days credit

DE advised of post-conviction rights

Abby H./minutes sent to DOC

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.
